Articles.Content:
Hello, kerbonauts!

I'm here to collect any crafts that you wish to share with the world on my new thread Passing time 'till 0.21

Im looking for anything that is fun and not serious. Mod crafts are allowed but please state what mods are needed for the craft to work.

Your craft can be anything that you think the KSP community would like to play with. We also accept save files. If you wish to post images, videos, designs, etc. please visit the main thread listed above.

If you think that your craft is not suitable please send some images or 3d design (not the craft itself, as my computer is currently broken) so that i can moderate it and tell you what to do with it.

If you wish to remain anonymous when posting to the main thread, that is fine. Just send me message saying that you want to remain anonymous and i can post it for you. If you posted more than 1 craft, please put your post number (E.G. i would be #1) and send that to me in the message saying that you want to be anonymous. No questions will be asked and i will post it for you.

That is all the notices about this thread which i hope you will enjoy.

Cheers,

PugSpaceProgram - OP

This is the Silver Arrow Mk 2, my heavy armored (almost) Crash proof muscle car!

Driving guide: Just drive with your rover controls, toggle the steering of the back wheels when diving fast so you don't make an accidental backflip or barrel roll. When braking, quickly tap the break button instead of holding it to avoid frontflips. And this is it!

Action keys:

1: Toggle Back wheel steering

2: Open solar Panels

3: Open doors

Pictures!

Download: Silver Arrow Mk 2

Please add reputation and give feedback

Oh by the way, it carries over 4500 units of electricity and has over 150 parts . The weight is almost 8 tons.
This is very good. Go ahead and add it to my post here!
Yeah, it's kinda a mash up of a '57 Chevy and an muscle car.
I'll just direct you guys to the link in the my signature.

I'll just direct you guys to the link in the my signature.

Feel free to add any, if not all of these crafts into the 'Passing time till 0.21' thread. I'm sure that everyone will enjoy these.
All four of my crafts that are on the Forums. Not nearly as much as I have in the save file though...
